column4: i have tried a lot of different ways to mount a shamba share that is mounted on boot through fstab, i need it to mount as user and group root but to follow the read write privs on the directory.. i have tried umask=000, rw, and a lot of different ways of setting it up
the privilages on the 'directory' dont matter.   for samba - you need to set some other options, could try 'smb4k' and see what all options its using to mount the share.
plus the samba server could be forceing it to be mounted read only.
